body:
Fictober Day 7

Because I’m bad at staying consistent and I had a good scene for todays prompt. Continuing with scenes from throughout my gunslinger elf’s, Kaecee, life.

Fandom: Not Critical Role exactly, but it is set in Taldorei.

Warning: Allusion to death by old age.

“No worries, we still have time.”

239

Kaecee opened the door to their bedroom with one hand, balancing the tray of porridge and juice on the other. Inside, Naomi’s hunched purple form slowly rose out of bed.

“Babe, you know you should stay in bed. Clerics orders,” Kaecee said, walking to her side and setting the food on the bedside table.

“Since when do you follow orders, let alone those given by a cleric?” Naomi teased, easing herself into a seated position against the backboard.

Kaecee grinned, taking a seat on the edge of the bed. “I have no orders to follow, but I have a duty to make sure you’re healthy and happy. So, this is an exception,” she said, leaning forward and kissing her wife deeply.

Naomi broke it off after a few moments, turning and coughing into her shirt. “I wish I were still as spry as you,” she murmured, leaning forward and resting her head on Kaecee’s shoulder.

“Yeah, well this is what you got when you fell for a grumpy elf,” Kaecee replied, leaning her head on Naomi’s. It was muscle memory that allowed her to avoid the still sharp horns without a second thought. “Plus we need you to get better so we can go see the Ozmit Sea again. Winters Crest in Emon was the prettiest.”

“I know. We haven’t seen Fen in forever. I just can’t seem to kick this cough…”

“Well, if you don’t listen to the clerics, you'll…”

Kaecee had to nip that train of of thought in the bud. She knew this would happen eventually. A young elf falling for a tiefling was a tragedy waiting to happen.

“No worries, Cici,” Naomi said softly, taking Kaecees hand in her own. “We still have time.”

From outside came a large crash and a loud roar that nearly drowned out the subsequent screams.

summary: Sam only picks D&D classes that allow him to conjure up magical floating hands he can perform weird antics with, but they only...
body: Sam only picks D&D classes that allow him to conjure up magical floating hands he can perform weird antics with, but they only get smaller with each character. Next campaign he can conjure up a swarm of tiny purple hands the size of bees.

I love you.

blog.description:
What happens when I procrastinate - reblogging pics and gifs, posting my fanfics (shenshen77), photographs and things that amuse me. Mostly Jeremy Renner, The Musketeers, Aidan Turner, Clintasha and penguins.
Sometimes NSFW, consider yourself warned! I tag everything.

summary: Bent, Not Broken (Critical Role, Jester & Fjord & Yasha, Gen)
title: Bent, Not Broken (Critical Role, Jester & Fjord & Yasha, Gen)
body:
Rating: Mature
Warnings: depiction of injuries, spoilers for episode 25-27 of campaign 2!

Day 7 of Whumptober, prompt is “Kidnapped”.
Gagged and bound, Jester has no access to her magic.

Bent, Not Broken

Jester slowly woke to the floor swaying below her, a fast and steady thump in one ear and the clopping of hooves in the other. She was leaning against something warm that smelled of leather, salt and sweat.

<Fjord?> she tried to say, but found herself gagged, hands bound behind her back. Her heart beat rapidly as her eyes flew open, pain lancing through her head. She sat up clumsily and carefully scanned her surroundings. Bars, covered by a tarp and - Yasha, whose eyes were closed, blood streaking down her pale face and pooling behind a muzzle. She remembered the eerily silent fight, Yasha falling and Fjord – Fjord!

Her eyes found his in the dim light of the cage. Fjord’s yellow eyes were wide, his chest rising and falling rapidly. He was muzzled as well, hands tied behind his back. There was blood on his face as well and he looked at her pleadingly, his stoic mask shattered.

Jester screamed. It only came out as a muffled yell.

Rating: Mature
Warnings: depiction of injuries, spoilers for episode 25-27 of campaign 2!

Day 7 of Whumptober, prompt is “Kidnapped”.
Gagged and bound, Jester has no access to her magic.

summary: critical role: pikelan  “Scanlan, if we get through this... You know what that means, don’t you?”  “No, what does it mean?”...
caption:
critical role: pikelan

“Scanlan, if we get through this… You know what that means, don’t you?”

“No, what does it mean?”

“You’ll just have to live. You wait and find out.”

“Well, what does it mean? What could it mean?”

“Just live! You’ll see!”

blog.name: karrey
blog.title: Karrey's Tumblr
blog.description:
I'm Karin "Karrey" Rindevall, a Swedish Comic Artist & Animator.

I'm currently working on my long form webcomic The Din.

I work at the game studio Image & Form in Gothenburg, Sweden.

I post The Din-related art & announcements here. I also post my other art & animations once in a while.

Right now I am into d&d. You'll find my personal d&d-related art tagged with Dudezillas. My Critical Role related art tagged with Critical Role. :)

As for the dnd-group I play in, we started recording our sessions for fun back in 2016 and have just started posting them online. Feel free to come listen!

Don't hesitate to ask me questions!




The Din
Twitter
Portfolio
Facebook
Youtube
Livestream
